policies.title: Air Travel Policy
policies.content: Economy class flights are approved for all domestic travel regardless of employee level. Business class is approved for international flights over 6 hours for Senior Managers (Level 7+) and above. First class is only approved for Directors (Level 9+) on international flights exceeding 8 hours, and requires VP pre-approval. All flights must be booked at least 14 days in advance unless emergency travel is approved by direct manager.

policies.title: Hotel Accommodations Policy
policies.content: Standard hotel accommodations are limited to $200 per night for domestic travel and $300 per night for international travel. Employees at Director level (Level 9+) may book accommodations up to $400 per night. All hotel bookings must be made through the approved corporate travel portal. Extended stays exceeding 5 nights require manager approval.

policies.title: Meal Expense Policy
policies.content: Daily meal expenses are capped at $75 per day for domestic travel and $100 per day for international travel. Individual meal limits: breakfast $20, lunch $25, dinner $50 (domestic). Alcohol is not reimbursable except for client entertainment with prior approval. Receipts required for all expenses over $25.

policies.title: Equipment and Software Policy
policies.content: Software purchases under $500 can be approved by direct manager. Software purchases between $500-$2000 require Department Head approval. Purchases over $2000 require VP approval and must go through IT procurement. Hardware purchases follow the same approval thresholds. All software must be on the approved vendor list.

policies.title: Client Entertainment Policy
policies.content: Client entertainment expenses are limited to $150 per person for meals. Team events with clients are capped at $1000 total and require manager pre-approval. Golf outings and similar activities require Director approval. All client entertainment must have documented business purpose and attendee list.

policies.title: Expense Approval Thresholds
policies.content: Expenses under $500: Direct manager approval. Expenses $500-$2000: Department Head approval. Expenses $2000-$10000: VP approval required. Expenses over $10000: CFO approval required. Emergency expenses up to $1000 may be submitted post-facto with documented justification within 48 hours.

policies.title: Delegation of Authority
policies.content: Managers may delegate approval authority to designated alternates during planned absences. Delegation must be documented in the expense system. Delegated approvers cannot approve expenses exceeding their own approval threshold. Self-approval of expenses is prohibited at all levels.

policies.title: Receipt and Documentation Requirements
policies.content: Original receipts required for all expenses over $25. Credit card statements are not acceptable as sole documentation. Missing receipts require a signed Missing Receipt Affidavit and manager approval. Expense reports must be submitted within 30 days of expense date. Late submissions may be denied.

policies.title: Prohibited Expenses
policies.content: The following are never reimbursable: personal entertainment, gym memberships, clothing (except safety equipment), political contributions, gifts to government officials, fines or penalties, personal travel upgrades, spouse/partner travel (unless pre-approved for specific events), and any expense lacking business purpose documentation.

policies.title: Employee Level Definitions
policies.content: Level 1-3: Individual Contributor (IC). Level 4-6: Senior Individual Contributor. Level 7-8: Senior Manager. Level 9-10: Director. Level 11-12: Vice President (VP). Level 13+: Senior Vice President and above. Approval authority and expense limits increase with level as defined in specific policies.
